blastCritical.recommendation: URGENT: Spray Tricyclazole or Tebuconazole within 24h. Improve drainage.

blastHigh.recommendation: Spray preventively within 48h and monitor the field closely.

brownspotHigh.title: âš ï¸ HIGH brown spot risk

brownspotMedium.title: ğŸ”¶ MODERATE brown spot risk

bacterialLeafHigh.title: âš ï¸ HIGH bacterial leaf blight risk

bacterialLeafHigh.recommendation: Spray Validamycin A or Kasugamycin and remove infected leaves.

heatHigh.title: ğŸŒ¡ï¸ Heat stress alert

heatMedium.title: ğŸ”¶ Warm conditions

bacterial_leaf_blight.info:
Leaf burn

ğŸ¦  Cause:
- Bacterium Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzae
- Develops strongly in humid conditions, temperature 25-30Â°C

ğŸ“‹ Symptoms:
- Leaves have long streaks from pale yellow to grayish white
- Streaks usually appear at leaf edges
- Leaves dry and die gradually from leaf tip
- Can cause severe damage if not treated promptly

âš ï¸ Severity Level: High
ğŸŒ¾ Vulnerable Stage: Tillering to heading
bacterial_leaf_blight.treatment:
Leaf burn Control:

âœ… Prevention:
1. Choose disease-resistant rice varieties
2. Treat seeds before sowing with hot water 52-54Â°C for 10 minutes
3. Improve drainage, avoid prolonged flooding
4. Apply balanced fertilizer, don't over-apply nitrogen
5. Clean rice straw after harvest

ğŸ’Š Treatment when diseased:
1. Antibiotics:
   - Validamycin 5% (30ml/20L water)
   - Kasugamycin 2% (40ml/20L water)

2. Copper-based:
   - Copper Hydroxide 77% WP (20g/20L water)
   - Spray every 7-10 days

3. Agricultural measures:
   - Cut diseased leaves, destroy away from field
   - Increase potassium to boost resistance
   - Avoid flooding rice in the afternoon

ğŸ“… Spray schedule: 2-3 times, 7-10 days apart

blast.info:
Blast Disease

ğŸ¦  Cause:
- Fungus Pyricularia oryzae (Magnaporthe oryzae)
- Most dangerous disease on rice

ğŸ“‹ Symptoms:
- Leaf blast: Diamond-shaped lesions, brown edge, gray-white center
- Neck blast: Broken neck, dead panicles
- Grain blast: Empty grains, reduced yield

âš ï¸ Severity Level: Very High
ğŸŒ¾ Vulnerable Stage: All stages, especially tillering and heading

ğŸ’§ Disease conditions:
- Temperature 20-30Â°C
- High humidity > 90%
- Fog, drizzle
- Excessive nitrogen, lack of potassium
blast.treatment:
Blast Disease Control:

âœ… Prevention:
1. Choose highly resistant rice varieties
2. Apply balanced NPK fertilizer, increase K and Si
3. Avoid excessive nitrogen application
4. Proper row spacing (ventilated, adequate light)
5. Treat seeds with fungicide before sowing

ğŸ’Š Treatment when diseased:
1. Triazole fungicides:
   - Tricyclazole 75% WP (15-20g/20L water)
   - Propiconazole 25% EC (20ml/20L water)

2. Strobilurin fungicides:
   - Azoxystrobin 25% SC (20ml/20L water)

3. Combined fungicides:
   - Tricyclazole + Hexaconazole (20g/20L water)

4. For severe cases:
   - Spray 3-4 times, 5-7 days apart
   - Rotate fungicides to avoid resistance

ğŸ“… Spray timing:
- Tillering stage: preventive spray
- When disease detected: spray immediately
- 7-10 days before heading: protect neck

âš ï¸ Note: Neck blast is very dangerous, prevent before heading!

brown_spot.info:
Brown Spot Disease

ğŸ¦  Cause:
- Fungus Bipolaris oryzae (Helminthosporium oryzae)
- Common in nutrient-deficient areas

ğŸ“‹ Symptoms:
- Small round or oval brown spots
- Spots have yellow edge, brown-gray center
- Many spots on leaves, gradually dry, reduced photosynthesis
- Infected grains turn dark brown

âš ï¸ Severity Level: Medium
ğŸŒ¾ Vulnerable Stage: Tillering to ripening

ğŸ’§ Disease conditions:
- Nutrient deficiency (especially N, P, K, Si)
- High humidity 80-90%
- Temperature 25-30Â°C
- Acidic, nutrient-poor soil
brown_spot.treatment:
Brown Spot Control:

âœ… Prevention:
1. Apply balanced NPK fertilizer
2. Supplement phosphorus, potassium and silicon
3. Improve acidic soil with lime
4. Use healthy, disease-resistant varieties
5. Treat seeds before sowing

ğŸ’Š Treatment when diseased:
1. Fungicides:
   - Mancozeb 80% WP (30-40g/20L water)
   - Edifenphos 50% EC (30ml/20L water)
   - Isoprothiolane 40% EC (30ml/20L water)

2. Combined spray:
   - Fungicide + foliar fertilizer (NPK)
   - Supplement zinc and silicon through leaves

3. Additional fertilization:
   - Balanced NPK fertilizer
   - Potassium fertilizer (increase resistance)
   - Lime if soil is acidic

ğŸ“… Spray schedule: 2 times, 10 days apart

ğŸ’¡ Tip: Brown spot is usually due to nutrient deficiency. Improving nutrition is the best way!

healthy.info:
Healthy Rice Leaves ğŸ‰

âœ… Assessment:
Your rice plant is in good condition, no disease signs detected!

ğŸŒ¿ Healthy leaf characteristics:
- Dark green, uniform color
- Leaf surface has no spots or streaks
- Strong leaves, standing upright
- No wilting or drying

ğŸ“Š Continue maintaining:
1. Apply fertilizer at right dose and time
2. Proper water management
3. Regular pest and disease monitoring
4. Keep field clean

ğŸ¯ Recommendations:
- Continue current quality care
- Regular observation for early disease detection
- Take photos to track plant development
healthy.treatment:
Rice Plant Health Maintenance:

âœ… Regular care:

1. Balanced fertilization:
   - Nitrogen: 3 splits (basal, tillering, heading)
   - Phosphorus: All at basal
   - Potassium: 2 splits (basal and heading)
   - Silicon: 100-150 kg/ha (increase resistance)

2. Water management:
   - Tillering stage: Shallow water irrigation
   - Drain field at right time
   - Keep 5-7cm water depth at heading

3. Pest and disease prevention:
   - Check field 2-3 times/week
   - Use light traps for night pests
   - Spray preventively in bad weather

4. Field sanitation:
   - Regular weed removal
   - Clean ditches and bunds
   - Destroy diseased plants if any

ğŸ“… Care schedule:
- Week 1-3: Monitor seedlings, basal fertilization
- Week 4-6: Tillering stage, 2nd nitrogen application
- Week 7-8: Drain field
- Week 9-10: Heading, potassium application
- Week 11-14: Ripening, harvest

ğŸ† Congratulations! Keep up the good care!

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How do I take photos to detect diseases?
faq.a1: Go to Home, tap the Camera button in the center of the screen. Take a clear photo of rice leaves and wait for analysis results.
faq.q2: How can I view photo history?
faq.a2: Go to Recognition History in the Account section to view all captured photos.
faq.q3: Can I ask experts about rice diseases?
faq.a3: Yes! Go to Expert Q&A History in Account and select an expert to start chatting.
faq.q4: How do I change my password?
faq.a4: Go to Account > Change Password in Account Settings section.
faq.a5: Yes, Doctor Rice is completely free for Vietnamese farmers.
faq.q6: How do I change text size?
faq.a6: Go to Account > Text Size in Account Settings section.
faq.q7: Where can I view the rice field map?
faq.a7: Tap the Map tab in the bottom menu bar to see the locations of captured photos.
faq.q8: How do I chat with AI about rice diseases?
faq.a8: Tap the Chat button in the bottom right corner of the Home screen to start chatting with Doctor Rice AI.

Bacterial Leaf Blight (Leaf burn)

ğŸ¦  Cause:
- Bacteria Xanthomonas oryzae pv. oryzae

ğŸ“‹ Symptoms:
- Long streaks from light yellow to gray-white on leaves
- Disease streaks usually appear at leaf edges

âš ï¸ Danger level: High
ğŸŒ¾ Susceptible stage: Tillering to heading
bacterial_leaf_blight.treatment:
How to prevent Bacterial Leaf Blight:

âœ… Prevention:
1. Choose disease-resistant rice varieties
2. Treat seeds before sowing with hot water 52-54Â°C for 10 minutes
3. Improve drainage, avoid prolonged flooding
4. Balanced fertilization, avoid excessive nitrogen
5. Clean up rice straw after harvest

ğŸ’Š Treatment when infected:
1. Antibiotics:
   - Validamycin 5% (30ml/20 liters water)
   - Kasugamycin 2% (40ml/20 liters water)

2. Copper fungicides:
   - Copper Hydroxide 77% WP (20g/20 liters water)
   - Spray every 7-10 days

3. Agricultural measures:
   - Remove diseased leaves, destroy away from field
   - Increase potassium to boost resistance
   - Avoid flooding rice in the afternoon

ğŸ“… Spray schedule: 2-3 times, 7-10 days apart

Blast Disease

ğŸ¦  Cause:
- Fungus Pyricularia oryzae (Magnaporthe oryzae)
- Most dangerous rice disease

ğŸ“‹ Symptoms:
- Leaf blast: Diamond-shaped lesions, brown edges, gray-white center
- Neck blast: Broken neck, dead panicles
- Grain blast: Empty grains, reduced yield

âš ï¸ Danger level: Very High
ğŸŒ¾ Susceptible stage: All stages, especially tillering and heading

ğŸ’§ Disease conditions:
- Temperature 20-30Â°C
- High humidity > 90%
- Fog, drizzle
- Excessive nitrogen, lack of potassium
blast.treatment:
How to prevent Blast Disease:

âœ… Prevention:
1. Choose highly blast-resistant varieties
2. Balanced NPK fertilization, increase K and Si
3. Avoid excessive or late nitrogen application
4. Proper row spacing (ventilated, sufficient light)
5. Treat seeds with fungicide before sowing

ğŸ’Š Treatment when infected:
1. Triazole fungicides:
   - Tricyclazole 75% WP (15-20g/20 liters water)
   - Propiconazole 25% EC (20ml/20 liters water)

2. Strobilurin fungicides:
   - Azoxystrobin 25% SC (20ml/20 liters water)

3. Combined fungicides:
   - Tricyclazole + Hexaconazole (20g/20 liters water)

4. When severe:
   - Spray 3-4 times, 5-7 days apart
   - Rotate fungicides to avoid resistance

ğŸ“… Spray timing:
- Tillering stage: preventive spray
- When disease detected: spray immediately
- 7-10 days before heading: protect neck

âš ï¸ Note: Neck blast is very dangerous, must prevent before heading!

brown_spot.info:
Brown Spot Disease

ğŸ¦  Cause:
- Fungus Bipolaris oryzae (Helminthosporium oryzae)
- Common in nutrient-deficient areas

ğŸ“‹ Symptoms:
- Small round or oval brown spots
- Spots with yellow edges, brown-gray center
- Many spots on leaves, gradual drying, reduced photosynthesis
- Infected grains turn dark brown

âš ï¸ Danger level: Medium
ğŸŒ¾ Susceptible stage: From tillering to maturity

ğŸ’§ Disease conditions:
- Nutrient deficiency (especially N, P, K, Si)
- High humidity 80-90%
- Temperature 25-30Â°C
- Acidic, nutrient-poor soil
brown_spot.treatment:
How to prevent Brown Spot Disease:

âœ… Prevention:
1. Balanced, complete NPK fertilization
2. Supplement with phosphorus, potassium and silicon
3. Improve acidic soil with lime
4. Use healthy, disease-resistant varieties
5. Treat seeds before sowing

ğŸ’Š Treatment when infected:
1. Fungicides:
   - Mancozeb 80% WP (30-40g/20 liters water)
   - Edifenphos 50% EC (30ml/20 liters water)
   - Isoprothiolane 40% EC (30ml/20 liters water)

2. Combined spray:
   - Fungicide + foliar fertilizer (NPK)
   - Supplement zinc and silicon via leaves

3. Additional fertilization:
   - Balanced NPK
   - Potassium (increase resistance)
   - Lime if soil is acidic

ğŸ“… Spray schedule: 2 times, 10 days apart

ğŸ’¡ Tip: Brown spot is often due to nutrient deficiency. Improving nutrition is the best way!

healthy.info:
Healthy Rice Leaf ğŸ‰

âœ… Assessment:
Your rice plant is in good condition, no disease signs detected!

ğŸŒ¿ Healthy leaf characteristics:
- Dark green, uniform color
- Leaf surface without spots or disease streaks
- Firm, upright leaves
- No drying or wilting

ğŸ“Š Continue maintaining:
1. Fertilize correctly, at the right time
2. Manage water properly
3. Monitor pests and diseases regularly
4. Keep field clean

ğŸ¯ Recommendations:
- Continue maintaining current care quality
- Regular observation for early detection if disease occurs
- Take photos to track plant development
healthy.treatment:
Measures to maintain rice plant health:

âœ… Regular care:

1. Balanced fertilization:
   - Nitrogen: Divide into 3 times (basal, tillering, heading)
   - Phosphorus: Apply all at basal
   - Potassium: Divide into 2 times (basal and heading)
   - Silicon: 100-150 kg/ha (increase resistance)

2. Water management:
   - Tillering stage: Shallow water
   - Field drying at the right time
   - Keep water depth 5-7cm at heading stage

3. Pest and disease prevention:
   - Check field 2-3 times/week
   - Use light traps for night pests
   - Preventive spray if weather is bad

4. Field hygiene:
   - Regular weed removal
   - Clean ditches
   - Destroy diseased plants if any

ğŸ“… Care schedule:
- Week 1-3: Monitor seedlings, basal fertilization
- Week 4-6: Tillering stage, second nitrogen application
- Week 7-8: Field drying
- Week 9-10: Heading, potassium application
- Week 11-14: Maturity, harvest

ğŸ† Congratulations! Keep up the good care!
